title: [$250] Fix IndexedDB transaction memory leak in multiMerge

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from slack [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1760106050038389) Proposal: Fix IndexedDB transaction memory leak in multiMerge ### Background: Onyx uses IndexedDB (via idb-keyval) as the storage layer on web. The multiMerge operation is one of the most frequently called storage operations, executing thousands of times during app initialization for accounts with substantial data. Currently, multiMerge uses a manual transaction pattern where it directly accesses the IDBObjectStore via idbKeyValStore('readwrite', (store) => {...}) to perform read-then-write operations within a single transaction. This pattern creates a transaction object that remains in memory along with all its associated IDBRequest objects and promise chains. For heavy accounts in Expensify, a single page load can trigger thousands of multiMerge calls, each creating these transaction structures. ### Problem: When users with heavy accounts load the app, if Onyx performs thousands of multiMerge operations, then the manual transaction pattern retains 383MB+ of memory in IDBDatabase and IDBTransaction objects that are never garbage collected, causing the app to crash or become unresponsive. ### Solution: Fix the multiMerge implementation to eliminate manual transaction management and let idb-keyval handle transaction lifecycle automatically ends. The specific code change is moving the .then(() => undefined) outside the idbKeyValStore callback so the transaction can complete immediately after all put operations finish, rather than being kept alive by the outer promise chain. Impact: Memory snapshots show this reduces the retained size from 383,727KB (36% of total heap) down to ~1,000KB (negligible). This also prevents the accumulation of 100,000+ IDBTransaction objects in memory. Draf PR: https://github.com/Expensify/react-native-onyx/pull/688

title: [$250] Calculate footer sub-totals in `Explore` sections on `Reports` when specific expenses are selected

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
At the moment we calculate footer sub-totals on the `Reports` page for all LHN sections with the exception of `Explore`. We adopted this approach for two reasons: 1) The data is unbounded and so querying it involves performance considerations; 2) A total of everything from all time has questionable utility. That said, when any expenses or reports are selected in `Explore` > `Expenses` or `Explore` > `Reports`, we would like to start counting footer totals, so number of expenses/reports and total value. I believe this update should be pretty straightforward, no matter if we're dealing with different currencies, using all the existing logic we already have, though let us know if you have any questions! cc @luacmartins

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.22-6 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** None **Issue reported by:** @JmillsExpensify ## Action Performed: 1. Be a member on a private domain with the `enableRestrictedPolicyCreation` securityGroup setting enabled ([Ref](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/6823a5842be9cba32ffb2803912076f8e91a2b70/src/types/onyx/SecurityGroup.ts#L5-L7)) 2. Go to Workspaces tab 3. Observe the `New workspace` button 4. Click the `New workspace` button 5. Observe it error out. ## Expected Result: This domain securityGroup setting prevents users from creating workspace, so let's hide the button like we do on Classic. Note: Please make sure to also hide the "New workspace" button in the global create FAB as well. ## Actual Result: The button shows and creating a workspace errors out ## Workaround: Yes, disable the domain security group setting. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.28-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1221/folder/13176730/41237110/941908457 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdionjsdoisjdos@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Log in with a new account 3. Create a workspace 4. Go to Inbox 5. Open FAB > Create report → The new report is created on Inbox 6. Create two more workspaces 7. Delete the default workspace 8. Go to Inbox 9. Open FAB > Create report 10. Select any workspace → The new report is created on Reports ## Expected Result: In Step 5 and 7, the new report should be created on the same tab ## Actual Result: In Step 5, when there is a default workspace, the new report is created on Inbox In Step 7, when there is no default workspace and there are at least two non-default workspaces, the new report is created on Reports ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop

title: [$250] Review duplicates- Navigation arrows only appear when expense RHP is opened for the first time

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.28-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1184/folder/13176670/41237097/940179030 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sodosndjsoijd@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat 3. Create two expenses with the same amount in workspace chat 4. Open the expense report 5. Open any transaction thread 6. Click Review duplicates 7. Click on any expense preview on Review duplicates RHP → Navigation arrows appear next to More button 8. Click RHP back button 9. Click on the same expense preview from Step 7 ## Expected Result: In Step 7 and 9, navigation arrows next to More button should appear consistently when expense RHP Is opened from Review duplicates RHP ## Actual Result: In Step 7, navigation arrows appear next to More button when the expense thread is opened for the first time In Step 9, navigation arrows do not appear next to More button when the expense thread is opened for the second time ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop
Platforms Tested: On which of our officially supported platforms was this issue tested: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
